title: Rear Brake Master Cylinder - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.

If the engine has recently been running, the exhaust components may be hot to the touch. Contact with the hot components may cause damage to exposed skin. To avoid skin damage, always allow the hot parts to cool before working on the exhaust system.
Caution - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Rear brake master cylinder removal YB1; YK1; YL1
The brake caliper will require removing and the pistons pushed out to back bleed the master cylinder as part of the brake bleeding procedure, see
Release the caliper mounting bolts and slide the caliper off the brake disc.
Make sure no damage is made to the brake pad material when moving the brake pads.
Allowing the brake pads to come into contact with each other or sharp objects may cause the material to crack or break.
Damage to the brake pads may result in reduced braking efficiency leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.

Using a suitable a flat metal plate approximately 2 mm thick and 30 to 50 mm wide (for example a gasket scraper) between the brake pads, pump the rear brake pedal until the plate is held by the brake pads.
When disconnecting the brake hose from the master cylinder it is necessary to keep the open end of the hose in an upright position.
Allowing the brake hose to fall downwards will allow an excessive amount of air to enter into the brake system.
Trapped air may cause the brake lever to feel spongy and contribute to reduced braking efficiency.
Remove the clip and clevis pin and detach the brake push rod from the brake pedal. Discard the clip.
Remove the fixings securing the brake master cylinder to the right hand control plate.
While supporting the master cylinder, release the fixings and remove the right hand control plate.

Noting it's orientation for installation, disconnect the brake hose from the master cylinder, discard the washers and allow the brake fluid to drain from the master cylinder outlet into a suitable container.

body.name: Rear master cylinder hose YK1 B00478
